header.name: chaos/preprocessor/facilities/indirect.h
header.author: Paul Mensonides
header.overview: The header defines a macro used to facilitate sequential indirection.

usage.param: The value to be indirected to macro. Valid values range from 0 to .

The macro to be invoked with n. This argument must be a macro name that refers to a macro with a signature compatible with the following pseudo-signature:
macro(n)

macro.para: This macro facilitates sequential indirection that passes a value from on iteration to the next. It halves the number of macros required to implement this type of operation.

This macro invokes macro with n. The intent is that macro(n) expands to another macro such that n is preserved through encoding in a macro name. For example,
#define ABC(n) ABC_ ## n #define ABC_0(x) x (0)
(0)(ABC)(a)(ABC)(b)() // a b
